item.title: Nevada add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "I've tried to reduce profanity but I reduced so much profanity when writing the book that I'm afraid not much could come out. Perhaps we will have to consider it simply as a profane book and hope that the next book will be less profane or perhaps more sacred." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "I love sleep. My life has the tendency to fall apart when I'm awake, you know?" -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no rule on how to write. Sometimes it comes easily and perfectly; sometimes it's like drilling rock and then blasting it out with charges." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Nevada add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Cut out all these exclamation points. An exclamation point is like laughing at your own joke." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Nevada add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I like people and I like them to like me, but I wear my heart where God put it, on the inside. " -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Nevada add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Before I go on with this short history, let me make a general observation– the test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in the mind at the same time, and still retain the ability to function. One should, for example, be able to see that things are hopeless and yet be determined to make them otherwise. This philosophy fitted on to my early adult life, when I saw the improbable, the implausible, often the "impossible," come true." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "As we grow old...the beauty steals inward." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Robert Bloch
item.description: "Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk." -- Robert Bloch

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Nothing stinks like a pile of unpublished writing." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Guy de Maupassant
item.description: "It is the lives we encounter that make life worth living." -- Guy de Maupassant

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don't say the old lady screamed. Bring her on and let her scream." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "If you do not breathe through writing, if you do not cry out in writing, or sing in writing, then don't write, because our culture has no use for it." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Karl Kraus
item.description: "A writer is someone who can make a riddle out of an answer." -- Karl Kraus

item.title: Nevada add a quote by Nevada Scheffler
item.description: "Art directors speak in pictures. If you want an art director to understand what you're saying, you need to draw some lines and circles on a piece of paper." -- Nevada Scheffler
